CatDescriptText: Beverly Gates, Homewood, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "I think there's a very good possibility that a Negro will be appointed to a police inspectorship, because the Democrats now are in office."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Beverly Gates wearing light colored head scarf and light colored coat with fur collar, standing on sidewalk of street with truck that reads "B-869 Railway Express"
